title: Merida most liveable Mexico city, Chilpancingo the worstTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Merida most liveable Mexico city, Chilpancingo the worst Published on : Friday, August 28, 2015
A survey conducted by Gabinete de Comunicacion Estrategica (GCE) reveals, Merida is the best city to live in Mexico, while Chilpancingo is the worst.
Merida, the capital of the southeastern state of Yucatan, received a score of 83.3 out of 100, followed by Saltillo, Coahuila, with a 79.6; and Aguascalientes, located in the like-named state, and Mazatlan, Sinaloa, both earning scores of 78.8, as per findings of the “Mexico’s Most Liveable Cities” survey.
GCE surveyed people in 60 cities across Mexico and 16 Mexico City boroughs, asking them to rate the quality of life based on a number of different factors, including housing, transportation, pollution and natural beauty.
The telephone survey of 30,000 adults in 76 cities was conducted June 16 to July 7.
The Mexico City boroughs receiving the highest quality of life ratings were Coyoacan, with a 69.6 score; and Benito Juarez and Miguel Hidalgo, both at 69.2.
Xochimilco, with a score of 60.9 points out of 100, was rated the worst borough of the capital to live.
